title: Portfolio Website
description: A personal portfolio website to showcase projects, skills, and experiences. You're looking at it right now!
features: Dynamic project showcase with detailed descriptions
goal: This portfolio website was built to create a professional online presence that showcases my technical skills, projects, and experiences in an engaging and accessible way. Using modern web technologies like Next.js 14 and Tailwind CSS, the site demonstrates both my front-end design capabilities and my understanding of performance optimization, accessibility, and user experience principles. The goal is to provide visitors with an intuitive journey through my work while maintaining a cohesive brand identity with soft star aesthetics and smooth, simple interactions.

title: PetPals
description:
ðŸŒŸSecond place hackathon project.
 An anonymous online platform designed to help users reflect on their emotions and connect with others in a supportive and uplifting environment.
features: Daily affirmations and mental wellness resources
Safe space for mental health discussions
goal: PetPals was created during a 24-hour hackathon with the theme of peace and inclusion. It was built with the belief that no one should have to face their mental health challenges alone. Too often, people keep their struggles to themselves, unsure of where to turn or worried about being judged. This project creates a safe and anonymous space where users can openly share their feelings, reflect on their emotions, and find comfort in knowing that others may be going through similar experiences. By encouraging kindness, empathy, and genuine connection, PetPals aims to break down barriers around mental health and foster a supportive community where everyone feels heard, accepted, and valued.

title: FitQuest
description: A fitness tracking application that helps users create custom workouts, control workout sessions, and track their favorite workouts.
goal: FitQuest aims to make fitness accessible and engaging for everyone by providing personalized workout experiences and community support. The product is intentionally optimized for use on phones, with responsive layouts and touch-friendly controls, recognizing that laptops are impractical in the gym. Built for a Humanâ€“Computer Interaction course, working with others, the web app went through multiple iterations following a task-centered design process, including scenario definition, and low- to high-fidelity prototyping. The result is a product that helps people stay motivated and consistent by offering tools to create, track, and share custom workouts. Whether you are starting a routine or optimizing advanced training, FitQuest provides the flexibility and insights needed to reach your goals.

title: RevRentals
description: A database-driven platform showcasing the integration of a relational database with a front-end application for managing rental properties.
goal: RevRentals demonstrates the power of well-designed databases in creating efficient rental management systems for both property owners and tenants. This project showcases a complete full-stack application with a robust MySQL database backend, handling complex relationships between users, properties, vehicles, and maintenance requests. The platform provides a seamless experience for landlords to manage their properties while giving tenants easy access to essential services, demonstrating best practices in database design, query optimization, and user authentication.
